page.title: 01The Hills North Of Largs
page.content: This area is mainly made up of the Noddleburn flowing from north to south bounded by high moorland to the east and lower, rolling hills to the west, with a gentle slope down to the sea beyond that. This slope has a few farms on it, mostly cattle farming with some silage and root crops. The sheep farming, which is the main industry with a little forestry work near the valley bottom. A tarmaced road links the farms along the valley and continues on to Greenock to the north. It also gives access to the water that seves the reservoir, which interupts the course of the Noddleburn, near the northern edge of the area.
